holidays.name: National Ice Cream Pie Day
holidays.description: A delightful day dedicated to celebrating the delicious fusion of ice cream and pie. Think creamy scoops meeting crumbly crusts for a cool, sweet treat perfect for summertime.
holidays.origin: This day gained popularity through ice cream enthusiasts and dessert bloggers who wanted to highlight this decadent dessert mashup.
holidays.funFact: Ice cream pies originated in the early 20th century when inventive bakers started layering pie crusts with ice cream and toppings as an easier alternative to ice cream cakes.

holidays.name: World Photo Day
holidays.description: A global celebration of the art, science, and history of photography. It’s a perfect day for snap-happy folks to get out and capture the world through their lenses.
holidays.origin: Commemorates the invention of the daguerreotype process announced in 1839, one of the first photographic processes.
holidays.funFact: The daguerreotype process took about 10 to 15 minutes of exposure to create an image, compared to today's billionths of a second!

holidays.name: Serendipity Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the happy accidents and unexpected discoveries that make life magical. It’s a day to embrace surprise moments and marvel at fortunate coincidences.
holidays.origin: Inspired by the word 'serendipity,' coined by Horace Walpole in 1754 after a fairy tale called 'The Three Princes of Serendip'.
holidays.funFact: Some of the greatest scientific discoveries, including penicillin, were results of serendipity.

holidays.name: Bad Poetry Day
holidays.description: An amusing day to have fun writing deliberately awful poetry. Embrace awkward rhymes, cheesy metaphors, and wobbly rhythms—it’s all about celebrating the wonderfully terrible!
holidays.origin: Created by poetry lovers who wanted a day to let go of serious poetry constraints and enjoy the humor in crafting bad verses.
holidays.funFact: Bad Poetry Day encourages both famous poets and amateurs alike to reveal their silly side—some 'bad poems' have gone viral for being hilariously bad.
